br.com.limaogames.librpg.framework.interfaces

Interface JobListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Job

    public interface JobListener
    Interface that implements common methods used by Job instance.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Limao Games
    Email: andreikeda@limaogames.com.br
    created on: 07/02/2014
    See Also:
    Accessory, Adventurer, Armor, Armor.Type, Job, Skill, Weapon, Weapon.Type

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

    • Method Detail

      • canEquipAccessory

        boolean canEquipAccessory(Accessory accessory)
        Returns if Adventurer can equip the Accessory passed through parameter.
        Parameters:
        armor - Accessory - instance of Accessory.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can equip the Accessory or false otherwise.

      • canEquipArmor

        boolean canEquipArmor(Armor armor)
        Returns if Adventurer can equip the Armor passed through parameter.
        Parameters:
        armor - Armor - instance of Armor.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can equip the Armor or false otherwise.

        Returns if Adventurer can equip the Helm passed through parameter.
        Parameters:
        armor - Helm - instance of Helm.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can equip the Helm or false otherwise.

        boolean canEquipShield(Shield shield)
        Returns if Adventurer can equip the Shield passed through parameter.
        Parameters:
        armor - Shield - instance of Shield.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can equip the Shield or false otherwise.

      • canEquipWeapon

        boolean canEquipWeapon(Weapon weapon)
        Returns if Adventurer can equip the Weapon passed through parameter.
        Parameters:
        weapon - Weapon - instance of Weapon.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can equip the Weapon or false otherwise.

      • create

        void create(long id,
          java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          int level,
          java.util.List<Job> prerequisites,
          java.util.List<Weapon.Type> allowedWeapons,
          java.util.List<Armor.Type> allowedArmors,
          java.util.List<Accessory.Type> allowedAccessories,
          java.util.List<Helm.Type> allowedHelms,
          java.util.List<Shield.Type> allowedShields,
          java.util.List<Skill> skills,
          int[] attBonus,
          int[] apIncrement,
          Job nextJob)
        Creates instance of Job.
        Parameters:
        id - - object's identifier.
        name - - object's name. It can be null, but it's not recommended.
        description - - object's description. It can be null.
        level - - object's level. It can't be bigger than MAX_LEVEL.
        prerequisites - - object's list of prerequisites to set this Job instance as Adventurer job.
        allowedWeapons - - object's list of Weapon instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedArmors - - object's list of Armor instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedAccessories - - object's list of Accessory instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedHelms - - object's list of Helm instances that are allowed to equip.
        allowedShields - - object's list of Shield instances that are allowed to equip.
        skills - - object's list of Skill that Adventurer learns.
        attBonus - - object's array of int that stores the amount increment on Adventurer attributes.
        apIncrement - - object's array of int that stores the amount of AP to level up.
        nextJob - - object's Job instance that keeps an instance of the next Job when Adventurer upgrade it.

      • levelUp

        boolean levelUp(int ap)
        Returns if Adventurer instance can level up its job. You can use the common xp or a variation (here it's called ap) to keep track of the amount xp Adventurer has on a job.
        Parameters:
        ap - - Integer amount of xp Adventurer has on a job.
        Returns:
        Boolean true if Adventurer can level up its job or false otherwise.

      • upgrade

        boolean upgrade(Adventurer adventurer)
        Returns if Adventurer can upgrade its job. This method is available if your game allows Job upgrade. Ex: a soldier job can be upgrade to warrior/general/other that you wish.
        Parameters:
        adventurer - Adventurer - instance of Adventurer.
        Returns:
        Boolean - true if Adventurer can upgrade its job or false otherwise.
